description: Floodlights used to illuminate work areas during night operations.
when_to_apply: Emergency night works, repairs, construction activities.
why_it_works: Improves visibility for workers and drivers.

description: Series of signs such as MEN AT WORK, ROAD WORK AHEAD, and DETOUR placed sequentially.
when_to_apply: All work zones needing advance driver alerting.
why_it_works: Prepares drivers for upcoming hazards.

description: Impact-absorbing device mounted on a truck to protect workers in mobile work zones.
when_to_apply: Moving roadworks, line-marking trucks, sweeping vehicles.
why_it_works: Reduces crash severity in rear-end collisions.

description: Safe walkway designated for pedestrians during construction.
when_to_apply: Urban footpaths undergoing repair.
why_it_works: Prevents pedestrians from entering the roadway.

description: Portable ramps for wheelchair users around construction sites.
when_to_apply: Footpath closures near hospitals, markets, public offices.
why_it_works: Ensures accessibility during construction.

description: Sign indicating that a flagger will be controlling traffic ahead.
when_to_apply: Work zones requiring manual traffic control.
why_it_works: Improves driver awareness and reduces sudden braking.
constraints: Must be placed before the flagger post.

description: Warning signs placed before temporary pavement drop-offs.
when_to_apply: Resurfacing zones where height differences exist.
why_it_works: Alerts drivers and reduces tire blowout risks.

description: Vehicle placed behind workers to shield them from oncoming traffic.
when_to_apply: Mobile maintenance works on highways.
why_it_works: Acts as a physical buffer.
constraints: Requires trained driver and proper markings.

description: Large, reflective drums used to block lanes or guide traffic.
when_to_apply: Long-duration work zones.
why_it_works: Highly visible and easy to re-arrange as work progresses.
constraints: Takes road space; can be moved by wind.

description: Staff assisting pedestrians safely through or around work zones.
when_to_apply: High pedestrian movement zones like markets or transit hubs.
why_it_works: Prevents pedestrian–vehicle conflict.

description: Flexible posts marking boundaries of the work zone.
when_to_apply: Any temporary obstruction on the roadway.
why_it_works: Increases visibility and guides vehicles away from hazards.

description: Battery or solar-based flashing amber lights placed on barricades.
when_to_apply: Night-time work or low visibility zones.
why_it_works: Enhances visibility of work zone boundaries.

description: Sign indicating the end of a work zone area.
when_to_apply: Every temporary construction zone.
why_it_works: Provides closure information and normal speed resumption.
constraints: Must be placed at correct distance after the work zone.

intervention: Crash Investigation and Root Cause Analysis
description: Systematic review of crash data, site conditions, and driver behavior to identify the primary cause of crashes.
when_to_apply: Any location with repeated fatal or serious injury crashes.
why_it_works: Identifies the actual underlying issue instead of applying generic fixes.
constraints: Requires crash data and field inspection.

description: Permanent or temporary interventions to reduce vehicle speeds at high-risk spots.
when_to_apply: Blackspots involving speeding-related crashes.
why_it_works: Speed reduction drastically cuts crash severity.
constraints: Requires enforcement; may face driver resistance.

description: Application of high-grip road surface material to prevent skidding.
when_to_apply: Wet-skid crashes, curves, steep descents.
why_it_works: Improves traction and reduces run-off-road crashes.
constraints: Moderate cost and periodic renewal required.

description: Geometric improvements such as channelization, raised islands, or converting to roundabouts.
when_to_apply: Blackspots at junctions with recurring angle or turning collisions.
why_it_works: Reduces conflict points and improves visibility.

description: Upgraded or new lighting at crash locations.
when_to_apply: Night-time crash clusters.
why_it_works: Improves reaction time and hazard recognition.

description: Zebra crossings, refuge islands, signals, and guardrails at pedestrian crash locations.
when_to_apply: High pedestrian crash frequency zones.
why_it_works: Reduces pedestrian–vehicle conflicts.

description: Closing unsafe U-turns or median openings that cause angle crashes.
when_to_apply: High-speed divided roads with frequent T-bone crashes.
why_it_works: Eliminates conflict points.

description: Increasing curve radius or modifying alignment to improve safety.
when_to_apply: Crash-prone curves with poor geometry.
why_it_works: Improves vehicle stability and reduces loss-of-control crashes.

description: Removing or relocating hazardous objects near blackspots.
when_to_apply: Locations with fixed-object collisions.
why_it_works: Eliminates serious roadside crash consequences.

description: Installing no-overtaking markings and signs at crash locations.
when_to_apply: Two-lane highways with head-on collisions.
why_it_works: Reduces lane invasion risk.

description: Installing W-beam or concrete barriers near run-off-road blackspots.
when_to_apply: High embankment or bridge-adjacent blackspots.
why_it_works: Reduces severity of roadway departure crashes.

description: Speed table designed to elevate pedestrian crossings.
when_to_apply: Urban areas with repeated pedestrian crashes.
why_it_works: Slows vehicles and increases pedestrian visibility.
constraints: Not ideal on bus routes or flood-prone areas.

description: Flashers installed at dangerous curves or intersections to alert drivers.
when_to_apply: Night-time or low-visibility blackspots.
why_it_works: Improves alertness.

description: Improving pavement, drainage, and surface roughness to eliminate skidding.
when_to_apply: Curves, downhill grades, wet-crash locations.
why_it_works: Reduces hydroplaning and loss-of-control incidents.

description: Clearing vegetation, removing obstructions, and improving sight lines.
when_to_apply: Rural curves, intersections with poor visibility.
why_it_works: Improves reaction time and confidence.

description: Adding a traffic signal at dangerous intersections based on warrant conditions.
when_to_apply: High crash intersections lacking control.
why_it_works: Improves traffic discipline and reduces angle crashes.
constraints: May cause congestion without proper timing.

description: Adjusting the lane alignment to remove sudden shifts or misalignment.
when_to_apply: Crash locations involving abrupt lane geometry changes.
why_it_works: Improves consistency and predictable vehicle movement.

description: Physical and visual devices to reduce speeds near blackspots.
when_to_apply: Urban areas with repeated pedestrian or side-impact crashes.
why_it_works: Forces drivers to slow down.

description: Fencing along the median or roadside to prevent unsafe pedestrian crossings.
when_to_apply: High-speed roads with frequent pedestrian fatalities.
why_it_works: Eliminates risky mid-block crossings.

description: Increased police presence, speed cameras, or radar guns deployed at crash hotspots.
when_to_apply: Any location with persistent rule violations leading to crashes.
why_it_works: Deters risky driving behaviors quickly.

description: Highly visible SCHOOL AHEAD boards placed before school entrances.
when_to_apply: All school frontages and nearby pedestrian conflict points.
why_it_works: Alerts drivers to slow down proactively.

description: Strictly enforced low-speed zones using signs and calming measures.
when_to_apply: School opening and closing hours, dense urban corridors.
why_it_works: Reduces crash severity for children.
constraints: Requires enforcement or physical calming devices.

description: Speed tables combined with zebra crossings.
when_to_apply: Schools on undivided roads or high-speed corridors.
why_it_works: Slows vehicles and enhances pedestrian visibility.
constraints: Not suitable for bus routes or flood-prone areas.

description: Trained personnel assisting children at crossings.
when_to_apply: Peak school hours, high pedestrian volume.
why_it_works: Provides behavior control and safe gap selection.

description: Flashers activated during school hours.
when_to_apply: Urban and rural school areas with high-speed traffic.
why_it_works: Increases driver attention at specific times.

description: Median island allowing two-stage crossing.
when_to_apply: Wide roads near schools.
why_it_works: Reduces crossing distance and exposure.

description: Large SCHOOL marking on the road surface.
when_to_apply: Approaches to school gates and crossings.
why_it_works: Provides additional visual warning.

description: Vertical calming to enforce low speeds.
when_to_apply: Minor roads around schools.
why_it_works: Reduces vehicle speeds to safe walking speed.

description: Fences guiding children to designated crossings.
when_to_apply: School entrance areas with chaotic movement.
why_it_works: Prevents sudden road entry by children.

description: Wider sidewalks for accommodating large groups of students.
when_to_apply: Urban school frontages with narrow footpaths.
why_it_works: Reduces pedestrian spillover into the road.

description: Lane shifts creating horizontal deflection.
when_to_apply: Urban streets with speeding issues near schools/markets.
why_it_works: Forces drivers to slow down.

description: Restricting parking to maintain visibility and safe movement.
when_to_apply: Schools on narrow urban roads.
why_it_works: Improves visibility and reduces conflicts.

description: Dedicated area off the carriageway for school vehicles.
when_to_apply: Schools located on busy roads.
why_it_works: Prevents double parking and road chaos.
constraints: Requires space inside/near the school boundary.

description: Trained senior students or parents managing movement outside the school.
when_to_apply: Morning and evening peaks.
why_it_works: Improves discipline and awareness.

description: Vertical posts to prevent vehicles from encroaching onto footpaths.
when_to_apply: Urban school areas with mixed traffic.
why_it_works: Protects pedestrians from moving vehicles.

description: Repositioning the school gate to reduce conflict with traffic flow.
when_to_apply: Schools located on blind curves or congested junctions.
why_it_works: Improves sight distance and safety.

description: Visual curb bulges to narrow lanes and shorten crossing distances.
when_to_apply: Urban intersections near schools.
why_it_works: Slows turning vehicles and improves pedestrian priority.
constraints: Must be reinforced physically to prevent encroachment.

description: Intersection platforms that force vehicles to slow when entering.
when_to_apply: Urban neighborhoods, school zones, residential streets.
why_it_works: Reduces speeds and prioritizes pedestrians.

description: Bright pavement art such as cartoon figures or slow warnings.
when_to_apply: Primary school zones.
why_it_works: Captures driver attention and encourages slow driving.

description: CCTV or radar-based systems monitoring speeding and improper parking.
when_to_apply: Accident-prone or high-volume school corridors.
why_it_works: Ensures compliance with speed and parking rules.
